IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: The University's mission is to provide students with a highly integrated learning experience that promotes excellence through interdisciplinary collaboration and innovation in education, research, and service.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The University's mission is to provide students with a highly integrated learning experience that promotes excellence through interdisciplinary collaboration and innovation in education, research, and service.
IRS990.Description: Higher education: Education of over 6800 students at the college level. During the 2009-10 academic year, the university conferred 491 undergraduate degrees, 601 graduate degrees and 151 doctorial degrees. The University offers programs in osteopathic medicine, allied health sciences, liberal arts, and other graduate and undergraduate majors.Additional facts: The University of New England includes Maine's only:-Medical School-College of Osteopathic Medicine-Master of Science-Physician Assistant Program.-Master of Science-Nurse Anesthesia Program-Post-baccalaureate certificate program in gerontology and addictions counseling.College of Osteopathic Medicine:Since its founding in 1978, the University of New England College of Osteopathic Medicine (UNECOM) has graduated over 2,300 physician alumni and had an extraordinary impact on the health care of Maine, New England, and the nation. During that time, graduates of UNECOM have distinguished themselves as residents in the finest and most competitive residency programs throughout the United States. Of all licensed physicians in Maine, more have graduated from UNECOM than any other medical school in the country.The UNECOM prepares students to become osteopathic physicians. About two-thirds of recent graduates have pursued careers in primary care. Graduates receive the Doctor of Osteopathic Medicine (D.O.) degree:*More than 60% of its graduates practice in primary care disciplines (Family Medicine, General Internal Medicine, Pediatrics, and Obstetrics & Gynecology).*State of Maine: 10% of practicing physicians are UNECOM graduates, comprising 15% of Maine's primary care physician workforce.*25% of UNECOM graduates practicing in Maine serve in rural areas.*New England: 17% of UNECOM graduates are practicing in medically underserved areas. Vice President for Research and Dean of College of Graduate Studies:The College of Graduate Studies is initially focusing on building strengths in four broadly defined disciplines, They are the Centers for Land-Sea Interactions, Neuroscience, Global Humanities, and Community and Public Health, The school's masters program in marine science has recently received a prestigious National Science Foundation training grant that will allow it to build a Ph.D. program. College of Pharmacy:The College of Pharmacy admitted its first professional doctoral classes in the fall 2009 and 2010 semesters, with 99 and 97 students respectively. Members of these culturally diverse classes are from all over the United States and the world. The College is poised for success in the areas of inter-professional education, scholarship, clinical practice and service. UNE's fourth College is located in a state-of-the-art, 48,000 square foot building on UNE's historic Portland, Maine campus.The College of Pharmacy aspires to become recognized nationally for the quality of both its professional degree program and its diverse research enterprise. The mission of the College will be to provide an outstanding environment for the teaching-learning process to effectively deliver a contemporary pharmacy curriculum designed to graduate competent practitioners for the state of Maine and the nation. Additionally, the College will establish and maintain an active and productive research enterprise for the discovery of new knowledge in the laboratory and in the patient care setting. College of Arts and Sciences:The College of Arts and Sciences offers more than 30 undergraduate majors, ranging from aquaculture and aquarium science to sport management. The College's graduate programs include a master of science in education and a Certificate of Advanced Graduate Study in Educational Leadership.The Marine Science and Research Center is the only facility of its kind on any university campus, giving researchers a unique opportunity to create important new knowledge in marine science, the environment and human health. This facility truly provides a window to the sea.UNE students, faculty and staff contribute thousands of hours of community service each year through the volunteer work and service learning.It is estimated that in FY 2010, UNE students volunteered approximately 10,000 hours of community service to more than 150 community agencies, organizations and many schools in a multitude of school districts. Many of these hours were part of the University's senior-year Core Curriculum Citizenship Seminar requirement.Westbrook College of Health Professions:The Westbrook College of Health Professions offers undergraduate programs in dental hygiene, nursing, applied exercise science and athletic training, and graduate programs in nurse anesthesia, occupational therapy, physical therapy, physician assistant and social work. The College has state-of-the art educational facilities and has pioneered the model of interdisciplinary health and wellness education. The College has the only accredited nursing program in the nation with an international branch campus though its association with Israel College. The Israel Branch Campus RN-BSN program is an international program developed to educate non-traditional students from Israel who are currently licensed and practicing registered nurses seeking baccalaureate preparation in nursing.Research:UNE is one of 24 members of the Maine Marine Research Coalition (MMRC), formed to strengthen Maine's capacity to conduct cutting-edge marine research, increase collaboration and interaction among marine-based research institutions throughout the state, and increase the visibility of marine-related industries state wide.The University of New England's College of Osteopathic Medicine is one of four members of the Maine Biomedical Research Coalition, created to foster biomedical research in Maine as an important part of the current and future Maine economy. The six institutions are conducting research on every major disease, including cancer, heart disease, diabetes, hypertension, Alzheimer's disease, cystic fibrosis, and glaucoma. The result will be better health and long-term economic benefits to the region.The Marine Science and Research Center is the only facility of its kind on any university campus, giving researchers a unique opportunity to create important new knowledge in marine science, the environment and human health. This facility truly provides a window to the sea.UNE receives grants from a number of prestigious national sources including NASA, National Science Foundation, U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, the National Institutes of Health, and the National Endowment for the Humanities. One of UNE's capital campaigns received $750,000 in a challenge grant from the Kresge Foundation, one of the most prestigious charitable foundations with some of the most rigorous standards in the nation.

Activity2.Description: Auxiliary services for the delivery of higher education such as mail and room and board for over 1,000 students:It is our mission to work in partnership with resident students to create a healthy and positive residential community, enhancing students' academic pursuits and providing opportunities for personal, social and spiritual growth. We promote an atmosphere rooted in civility and personal responsibility and encourage reflective thinking and active involvement. With service learning at the core of our mission, the staff strives to teach, model, and learn with the students the values of community, inquiry, integrity, and caring.Utilizing our close relationship with Student Activities, our aim is to have a positive impact on campus life for the entire University. To do this, we must actively engage a variety of students in many arenas and keep abreast of the campus climate and of the needs of our students.Living and Learning Communities:Padua HallInterest Pods: First-Year Student Living & Learning CommunitiesPadua Hall will consist of six "pods," or clusters of student rooms that will each house 9-12 students and a Resident Advisor. Each pod is its own separate community within the building. With the guidance of a faculty member/staff advisor, an Area Coordinator, and a student Resident Advisor, students in each pod will have the opportunity to engage in their particular Thematic Core throughout the academic year. Building FeaturesPadua Hall is a three-story, co-ed residence hall with community bathrooms, laundry room, kitchenette, and a lounge on the second floor. Each bedroom is designed to hold 2 students with internet and phone access for each student. Rooms are furnished with a bunkable twin extra-long size bed and mattress, desk, chair, dresser, and wardrobe for each student.Additional facts:University of New England Dining Services:Using input from our students through comment boards, personal contacts between students and Food Service Managers, and regular meetings with campus Dining Advisory Committees, we stay in step with our students' needs and desires. We urge all new UNE students to take advantage of any of the above methods of connecting in order to maintain an innovative and creative dining service meet all of student's diverse dietary choices.E Services:The University of New England offers a number of on-line services for our students, faculty and staff:U-Online - U-Online provides students, faculty, and staff with secure, web-based access to selected administrative, academic, and employee records. U-Online is the only on-line official web-based source of information from the University of New England. Blackboard/WebCT - The Blackboard Learning System is a course management system with teaching and learning tools for course preparation, delivery, and management. myUNE - myUNE provides UNE students, faculty and staff with Intranet and Internet services, such as email, personal schedules, and campus calendars.

Activity3.Description: Health care clinics that saw over 75,000 patient visits, and provided clinical training opportunities for medical students and residents. Occupational Therapy and Dental hygiene clinics for education and training.Additional facts: The University of New England's University Health Care has eight medical clinics in Southern Maine located in Portland, Saco and Biddeford. The Dental Hygiene Clinic, a learning laboratory for students in the Dental Hygiene Program at the Westbrook College Campus in Portland, provides low-cost oral health services to more than 5,000 Portland-area residents each year.About 40 medical students each year volunteer hundreds of hours at the Biddeford Free Clinic. UNE dental hygiene students provide low cost health services to more than 5,000 patients each year.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The policy of not reporting works of art is not present in the financial statements.

The University houses the Maine Women writers collection of literature. There is also an art gallery that exhibits painting and other works of art. These collections and exhibits further the liberal arts Curriculum and scholarly activities.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Part V, line 4: The University uses income from its endowment in accordance with the donors' wishes. Most of the donor restricted income is for student scholarships. If the donor makes no restrictions or if the endowment is Board created, the income is used for scholarships and/or general use.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE UNIVERSITY IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES UNDER INTERNAL REVENUE CODE (CODE) SECTION 501(C)(3) WHEREBY ONLY UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME, AS DEFINED BY SECTION 512(A)(1) OF THE CODE IS SUBJECT TO FEDERAL INCOME TAX. FASB ASC TOPIC 740, INCOME TAXES (FORMERLY STATEMENT OF FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS (SFAS) NO. 109, ACCOUNTING FOR INCOME TAXES AND FASB INTERPRETATION 48, ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES) CLARIFIES THE ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES RECOGNIZED IN AN ENTERPRISE'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND PRESCRIBES A THRESHOLD OF MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT FOR RECOGNITION OF TAX BENEFITS OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN IN A TAX RETURN. ASC TOPIC 740 ALSO PROVIDES RELATED GUIDANCE ON MEASUREMENT, CLASSIFICATION, INTEREST AND PENALTIES, AND DISCLOSURE. Based on its analysis, the University has determined that the adoption of ASC 740 does not have a material impact to its financial statements. However, the University's conclusions may be subject to review and adjustment at a later date based on factors including, but not limited to, further implementation guidance expected from FASB and on-going analyses of tax laws, regulations and interpretations thereof.
Netted Fund raising income and expense: -2819.

Form990ScheduleFPartIV.Explanation: Schedule F, Part I, Line 2: The University had program revenue from Israel College. The University taught Israeli College nursing students various liberal arts courses in Israel.

Form990ScheduleFPartIV.Explanation: Schedule F, Part I, Line 3: Accrual

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: The University's Office of Student Financial Services awards all federal and state financial aid grants in accordance with the federal and state regulations. Donor restricted grants are awarded in accordance with the donor's wishes.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Membership to a social club whose members are business leaders in the local community. Housing allowance for a key employee and for convenience of the university.

Severance pay of $43,518 was paid to the former Vice President for Business and administation. pART i, LINE 4B: The University has a non-qualified Supplemental Executive Retirement Plan for the President for which the University contributed $22,750.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The 990 is reviewed by Legal Affairs Audit Committee of the Board. The 990 also is made available to each member of the Board.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Trustees and key employees are required to turn in a conflict of interest report at least annually. The reports are reviewed by the legal committee. The legal committee brings any conflicts to the full board. Should an issue arise in which a board member or key employee has a conflict, the individual is required to recuse themselves from any and all activities related to the conflict.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The University hired an outside consulting firm and created a Compensation Committee to make every effort to ensure that the President's compensation is reasonable, fair and equitable. Minutes are kept for the Compensation Committee meetings. The President's compensation is also approved by the full board. The President of the University sets salaries for key executives. The President annually reviews independent salary data from like institutions to ensure that salaries and wages are within the appropriate ranges. Contemporaneous documentation of the process is completed by said individual.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 18
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Information is available on WWW.Guidestar.org. Information is forwarded to anyone who requests it.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Financial statements, conflict of interest policy, and governing documents are available upon request. The financials are available in the library or on the web. The website is www.guidestar.org.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: LINE 2C-DOES ORGANIZATION HAVE A COMMITTEE THAT ASSUMES OVERSIGHT OF AUDIT?
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THERE HAVE BEEN NO CHANGES IN THE COMMITTEE'S RESPONSIBILTY FOR THE OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT.

CORE VALUES STATEMENT The University of New England values student-centered, multi-disciplinary and interdisciplinary programs that meet the highest ethical standards to achieve excellence in support of an integrative approach to the liberal arts, health and the environment, as well as scholarship and research. Student Centered *Personal contact with community *Genuine personal relationships *Experiential learning *Life-long learning Excellence and Innovation *Quality academics *Respect for new ideas *Critical thinking *Entrepreneurial *Agility and flexibility Interdisciplinary *Integration *Seek connections across disciplines Integrity and Ethical Behavior *Honesty, respect, trust *Academic freedom Global Community & Diversity *Embrace & learn from diversity *Service & civic engagement *Social justice *Non-discriminatory Health and Wellness *Whole person wellness *Osteopathic healing *Integrative health care Environmental Stewardship *Healthy environments *Sustainability Scholarship and Research *Create new knowledge *Collaboration
